dgantt
Class GanttChart

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              dgantt.GanttChart
All Implemented Interfaces:
GanttModelListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class GanttChart
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements GanttModelListener

A Gantt chart swing component. A Gantt chart is constructed by providing a GanttModel and a Translator. The GanttModel stores all tasks displayed in the Gantt chart in addition to controlling several additional settings. The Translator extracts the necessary information from user-defined objects, such as the start and end values of the task, to render the Gantt chart tasks. An optional LinkModel can provide visual links between tasks to represent arbitrary requirements or constraints.

This component provides the basic Gantt chart functionality, but is intended to be extended with custom renderers and listeners to provide more complex behavior.

See Also:
Serialized Form

getSelectedTasks

public java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> getSelectedTasks()
Returns the set of selected tasks. Changes to the returned set will be reflected in the Gantt chart, requiring the invocation of fireSelectionEvent(). This is primarily intended to allow multiple changes to the set of selected tasks while only firing one selection event.

Returns:
the set of selected tasks

getTaskAtPoint

public java.lang.Object getTaskAtPoint(java.awt.Point point)
Returns the task at the specified point; or null if no task exists at that point. Pick ordering is such that selected tasks are picked first, followed by tasks in reverse order from their position in the GanttModel.

Parameters:
point - the point
Returns:
the task at the specified point; or null if no task exists at that point
